snippet: New measures proposed by the Obama administration include many good ideas but do not do enough to protect the privacy of Americans.
abstract: Editorial welcomes Pres Obama's measures to oversee drone use by government agencies, but says they fall short of fully protecting Americans' privacy; notes Federal Aviation Administration's latest proposals allow commercial use of drones but with restrictions; contends that with such a new technology, efforts must be made to lay down appropriate uses for such devices.
lead_paragraph: New measures proposed by the Obama administration include many good ideas but do not do enough to protect the privacy of Americans.
